headline: Pa. attorney general, McKeesport police chief give update on law enforcement partnership
sentences: Attorney General Josh Shapiro, who is running for governor, spoke alongside McKeesport Police Chief Adam Alfer and Pittsburgh Police Chief Scott Schubert at the McKeesport Palisades on Fifth Avenue.

MCKEESPORT, Pa. â€”
Pennsylvania's attorney general and McKeesport's police chief and mayor are giving an update on a law enforcement partnership in the Mon Valley on Thursday morning.
"We have taken a significant amount of narcotics and firearms off the streets of McKeesport and other Mon Valley communities," Alfer said.
The partnership of the attorney general's Strategic Response Team with local police departments began in July.
It's critically important for us to work together, to help one another, to make our communities safer."
"I can't stress enough the value of these partnerships with law enforcement agencies.

What happens in Pittsburgh affects McKeesport," Schubert said.
"That's the same for all the other communities in our area.
Shapiro said it has led to 71 arrests and 46 guns seized.

A lot of police work is getting done."
It's helping make the streets safer.
